mission: Mission 2026: Time Warp - Autonomous Flight Skills
description: Optimized waypoint sequence for maximum autonomous scoring
coordinate_system: Field coordinates in inches from starting position

strategy.objective: Complete all scoring tasks in optimal order

waypoints.description: Take off from starting position to 3 feet altitude
Fly under Blue or Red Arch Gate at low altitude
waypoints.notes: Arch inner height is 63 inches - fly at 30 inch altitude for safety margin
Align with center of Keyhole Gate (24 inch inner diameter)

waypoints.description: Fly through Green or Yellow Keyhole Gate
waypoints.notes: 24 inch inner diameter - maintain centered flight path
Maintain steady flight through 19 inch tunnel

waypoints.description: Descend to low altitude over Color Mat
waypoints.notes: Color Mats are 24x24 inches - need to be low for color sensor

waypoints.description: Identify color of Color Mat (red, blue, or green)
waypoints.notes: Hover over mat for accurate color detection
Panel has Large Hole (10 inch) at bottom and Small Hole (8 inch) at top

waypoints.description: Fly through Small Hole (8 inch diameter) for bonus points
waypoints.points: TBD - Check manual + Small Hole Bonus
waypoints.notes: Small hole gives bonus points - requires precise flight control
Landing Pad is 30 inches diameter with 10 inch bullseye
Align with 10 inch bullseye for maximum landing points

waypoints.description: Land on bullseye for maximum points
waypoints.notes: Landing on bullseye (vs landing pad) should give maximum points

timing_analysis.notes: Leaves 2+ minutes buffer for error recovery and adjustments

optimization_notes: Route minimizes turns and maximizes smooth transitions
Prioritizes Small Hole Bonus for additional points
Targets Bullseye landing for maximum landing points
Conservative flight path allows for sensor delays and positioning adjustments
Total path completion under 1 minute leaves ample time for multiple attempts if needed

sensor_requirements: Bottom-facing distance sensor for altitude control
Color sensor for Color Mat identification
Optical flow or position tracking for precise navigation

control_parameters.position_tolerance: ±2 inches for obstacles, ±1 inch for small holes

safety_margins.arch_gate: Fly 30 inches high (33 inch clearance below gate)
safety_margins.small_hole: Requires excellent position control - only 8 inch diameter

scoring_strategy.completion_order: Sequential - all tasks in order for maximum efficiency

field_layout_assumptions: Skills Mission Field uses standard REC Foundation layout
Gates and obstacles arranged in sequence for efficient flow
Coordinates are estimates - must be calibrated to actual field setup
Origin (0,0,0) is drone starting position on Programming Mat
calibration_required: Measure actual gate positions on competition field
Test color sensor height over Color Mat
Verify tunnel alignment and approach angle
Practice small hole passage - highest difficulty task
Confirm landing pad location and bullseye alignment
recommended_testing: Test each waypoint individually before full run
Validate sensor readings at each scoring location
Practice small hole passage extensively (most difficult)
Test complete autonomous run at slower speeds first
Record successful parameters for competition day
